--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "joelwint" <joelwint@...> wrote:
>
> Okay,
> =

> At the end, i found out my mistake !! That was coming from the
> securit=
y manager (The exception was not given by the getResource 
call
> but i fou=
nd it using an other way). It seems that Eclipse use a
> specific way to la=
unch JUnit Test (through its plugin and a socket
> connection) and Eclipse =
Junit plugin codebase (defined into java
> policy file) was not allowed to =
read my config file (retrieved by
> getResource). So i added the following:=

> 
> grant codeBase "file:/usr/local/eclipse/plugins/-" {
>      //For Jun=
it
>      permission java.net.SocketPermission "*:1024-",
> "connect,accept=
,listen,resolve";
>     //for my config
>     permission java.io.FilePermis=
sion "/path/to/my/config/-
", "read";
> };
> 
> And now it works...
> Hope =
it could help others too !
> 

That's great job.Congratulate you.
I think i=
t's better to post the detail exception stack to help other 
find the probl=
em more easily.:)

Regards.

Yang Gu
